intro: Eriogonum brevicaule var. ephedroides, commonly known as the Ephedroid Bristlecone, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered with fine, bristly hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The species is noted for its hardiness and ability to thrive in harsh, dry conditions.
